snippet: Dozens of artists could be affected by the decisions of a bankruptcy trustee appointed to run the Los Angeles gallery, founded in 1967.
abstract: Ace Gallery in Los Angeles is undergoing bankruptcy reorganization and several artists have filed claims hoping to recover pieces that were deposited on consignment; legal status and whereabouts of works are unclear due to disorganized records kept by gallery founder Douglas Chrismas, who is notorious for routinely failing to pay artists and other creditors.
lead_paragraph: Dozens of artists could be affected by the decisions of a bankruptcy trustee appointed to run the Los Angeles gallery, founded in 1967.

headline.main: Artists Fight to Get Works Back From Ace Gallery
headline.print_headline: Creditors at a Gallery’s Door, Followed by a Line of Artists
